For the sake of the child (and the mother), the mother's [[Interpretation of an SD-236 serology result|HIV status]] should be known. Screening should be offered systematically at the beginning of pregnancy (at the time of notification), even if it is not compulsory.

properties.question: When should systematic HIV screening be offered to pregnant women according to the guidelines for preventing foetal risks?
properties.option_a: Only after the child is born
properties.option_b: During the second trimester regardless of initial notification
properties.option_c: At the time of notification, at the beginning of pregnancy
